alert.note: Alert for Southern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 25 at 2:36PM EDT until September 26 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following counties, Chautauqua, Northern Erie and Southern Erie. The heaviest rainfall will likely fall close to the Lake Erie shore. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy lake effect rain late tonight through late Tuesday night may result in flooding. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts are possible where lake effect rain is most persistent. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
